name: Who's Joe Garagiola? Online Trivia | MLB Players | 10 Questions

questions.text: In what state was Joe born?
questions.explanation:
Missouri.

	Joseph Henry Garagiola was born on Friday, February 2, 1926, to John and Angeline Garagiola. He grew up on Elizabeth Street in St. Louis which was called "the hill". Yogi Berra lived across the street from him and his family.

questions.text: What war did Joe fight in?
options: He never fought in a war
questions.explanation:
World War II.

	Joe joined the Army during World War II before going to play baseball. He was one of 4,000 minor league players and 500 major league players to be drafted into the war. He fought in the Phillipines during 1944 and 1945.

questions.text: How old was Joe when he first played major league baseball for the Cardinals?
questions.explanation:
20.

	Joe was signed at the age of 16 by Branch Rickey. He didn't play in the majors until he was 20 and then his first game was on May 26, 1946. His first season he won a World Series ring when the Cardinals beat the Red Sox.

questions.text: Joe is a left handed batter.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Joe may have been a left handed batter, but he was a right handed catcher. He played 676 games in his career and five World Series games.

questions.text: What team did the Cardinals trade Joe to in 1951?
questions.explanation:
Pittsburgh Pirates.

	The St. Louis Cardinals traded Joe and four other players for Cliff Chambers and Wally Westlake from the Pirates. Joe and President Gerald Ford were close friends.

questions.text: What award did Joe win in 1991?
questions.explanation:
Ford C. Frick award

	Joe won the Ford C. Frick award in 1991 for broadcasting and was inducted into the Baseball Hall of Fame.

Catcher.

	He played journeyman catcher. When Joe was 24, he separated his shoulder after avoiding a collision with Dodger player, Jackie Robinson at second base.

questions.text: What year did the Pirates trade Joe to the Cubs?
questions.explanation:
1953.

	Joe was traded with three others to the Chicago Cubs on June 4, 1953. Money was also traded with the men.

questions.text: How many seasons did Joe play baseball?
questions.explanation:
9.

	Joe's last game was on September 26, 1954. He was with the New York Yankees when he retired. He carried a .258 batting average.

questions.text: When did Joe win the Peabody Award?
questions.explanation:
1973.

	Joe won the Peabody Award for excellence in broadcasting. He started his broadcasting career in 1955 in St. Louis, and then worked at NBC.
